headline: Grid Expansion Accelerates in Southwest
summary: New infrastructure projects aim to boost energy resilience across California and Arizona.

headline: AI Models Reshape Forecasting for Renewables
summary: Machine learning tools are improving accuracy in solar and wind output predictions.

headline: EQT to Supply Natural Gas for Data Center Campus in Pennsylvania
summary: EQT Corporation will provide natural gas to power a new data center campus in Pennsylvania, marking a strategic intersection of energy infrastructure and digital expansion.

headline: Tesla Shuts Down Dojo Supercomputer
summary: Tesla ends its Dojo AI training project, pivoting to Nvidia chips and Samsung manufacturing. The move marks a strategic shift in AI infrastructure, with engineers launching DensityAI.

headline: California Approves $2B for Clean Energy Infrastructure
summary: The state legislature passed a bill allocating $2 billion toward renewable energy projects, including offshore wind and grid modernization.

headline: Sempra Launches AI-Powered Grid Optimization Platform
summary: Majestic Sierra now integrates predictive analytics to optimize energy distribution across California’s infrastructure.

headline: Houthi rebels say Israeli airstrike killed their prime minister in Yemen's capital
summary: The Iranian-backed Houthis said an Israeli airstrike killed the prime minister of the rebel-controlled government in the Yemeni capital, Sanaa.

headline: 139 days: 3 Scottish brothers set a record for fastest row across the Pacific
summary: Jamie, Ewan and Lachlan Maclean completed the fastest unsupported row across the Pacific, arriving in Cairns, Australia, on Saturday. They rowed over 9,000 miles non-stop from Peru.

headline: Photos: Mother Nature must be really annoyed at our fakery
summary: A polar bear in a zoo, a hotel balcony overlooking elephants, a tree mural shrouded by haze: They're images from the new book The Anthropocene Illusion, about the way humans are remaking Earth.

headline: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy for 2nd time in less than a year
summary: The budget carrier filed for fresh bankruptcy protection months after emerging from a Chapter 11 reorganization. The airline said it plans to keep flying as usual during the restructuring process.

headline: Opinion: It's time to 'move our feet'
summary: The shooting this week at a Minneapolis Catholic school that killed 2 children won't the be last such incident. NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the cycle of school shootings and their aftermaths.

headline: Texas advances bill allowing citizens to sue makers and distributors of abortion pills
summary: Texas lawmakers are on track to pass one of the toughest laws aimed at reducing the use of abortion medication, one way people still have abortions in a state that has banned them.

headline: Queen's Classic 'Bohemian Rhapsody' finds a new voice in Zulu
summary: It's one of the most famous rock songs ever — Bohemian Rhapsody — and now, for the first time, it's been translated with Queen's blessing into Zulu.

headline: As drug deaths hit a 5-year low, Trump continues to cite fentanyl as major threat
summary: Drug deaths in the U.S. are at their lowest level since March 2025, according to federal data. Trump continues to cite fentanyl as justification for policies ranging from tariffs to immigration.

headline: 3 dead after mob sets fire to Indonesian regional parliament building
summary: An angry mob set fire to a local parliament building in an Indonesian provincial capital, leaving at least three people dead and five others hospitalized, officials said.

headline: Dear Life Kit: Do I have to buy birthday gifts for my 18 nieces and nephews?
summary: Experts answer a round of finance questions from NPR's audience, including how to financially support a friend with Stage 4 cancer and how to stop paying for your parents.

headline: Yemen's Houthi rebels say prime minister was killed in Israeli strike
summary: Ahmed Ghaleb Nasser al-Rahawi and several other Houthi officials were killed in the attack, the Iran-backed movement says.

headline: First week 'critical' to avoid children missing school later, parents told
summary: Data suggests more than half of children who miss a day at the start of term become persistently absent.

headline: The trade in US body parts that's completely legal - but ripe for exploitation
summary: Human remains can mean profits. But there is an emotional debate about the ethics of the industry.

headline: Councils still plan asylum hotel legal action despite Epping ruling

headline: Prominent Ukrainian politician Andriy Parubiy shot dead in Lviv
summary: President Zelensky said the killing of Parubiy was a "terrible murder" - with a manhunt under way.

headline: Breach scores hat-trick in record England World Cup win
summary: Jess Breach scores a hat-trick as England thrash Samoa in Northampton to register a record Women's Rugby World Cup win.

headline: Manhunt in Australian bush brings long-dismissed conspiracy theorists to the fore

headline: How coffee chains like Costa lost the matcha generation
summary: Costa's owner Coca-Cola is reportedly looking to sell the chain as its popularity cools off. So has something gone wrong?

headline: Request to silence town clock at night rejected

headline: Teen arrested over imitation firearm 'was on way to comic convention'

headline: Community moves thousands of fish after brook dries out

headline: AI stethoscope could detect major heart conditions in seconds
summary: The new technology could be a "game-changer" resulting in patients being treated sooner, experts say.

headline: Three killed and dozens injured in train derailment in Egypt
summary: The train had been travelling from Marsa Matruh to the Egyptian capital Cairo when it came off the tracks.

headline: Trump administration moves to fire most Voice of America journalists
summary: Termination notices have been issued to more than 500 employees of VOA and its parent agency.

headline: British man dies in Benidorm after swim

headline: Gordon Ramsay says he had treatment to remove skin cancer

headline: 'I can't lift a bag into an overhead locker but I climbed K2'

summary: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes' stoppage-time penalty gives Ruben Amorim's side a 3-2 victory against Burnley at Old Trafford.
